headline: Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) Faces Shareholder Push On Political Spending Alignment
summary: The latest shareholder activism involving As You Sow, who urged Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) shareholders to vote for a proposal to report on political spending, emphasized the increasing demand for corporate accountability. This followed a quarter where the company increased its dividend by 5.2% and repurchased shares worth $559 million. Meanwhile, Coca-Cola's earnings report highlighted a slight decline in net income despite a 2.9% market rise over the last week. Amid a general market backdrop...

headline: Coca Cola bottlers raided by EU antitrust regulators, source says
summary: Coca Cola bottlers were raided by EU antitrust regulators earlier this month, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said.  The European Commission announced the raids on non-alcoholic drinks companies in several EU countries on March 10 but did not name them.  The raids targeted Coca Cola bottlers, the person said, declining to provide details because of the sensitivity of the matter.
